availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Thompson (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of George Thompson and Lucy Thompson. Married to Mary Jane Campbell Thompson in Trimble County, Kentucky, on October 10, 1848. Father of Lucy J. Thompson, William C. Thompson, Emma F. Thompson, Mary A. Thompson, Richard F. Thompson, Leslie Thompson, and John Thompson. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Owned thirty-two enslaved individuals in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Employed John Marrs as a farmhand in Mercer County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved individuals in Mercer County in 1860.
